name: A class name should start with an upper case letter (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all the classes that do not respect the naming convention. The name of the class should start with an upper case character.
output:
This report lists all the Classes that do not respect the naming convention.

This QR provides the following information:
Class full name.
rationale: Using naming convention makes the source code easier to read and therefore to maintain.
remediation: Modify source code to reduce the number of classes that do not respect the naming convention.
remediationSample:
<?php
   class CastTest{ //violation removed
    // items
    var $items;

    // add an item

    function add_item($artnr, $num) {
        $this->items[$artnr] += $num;
    }
}
?>
